SENTENCE.STRING: (Latin: Mons Circeius) is an isolated promontory on the southwest coast of Italy, about 100 km south/southeast of Rome, near San Felice Circeo, on the coast between Anzio and Terracina;
is a part of Circeo National Park.
is a ridge of limestone about 5 km long by 1.5 km wide at the base, running from east to west and surrounded by the sea on all sides except the north.
The land to the north of
is 15 m above sea level, while the summit of the promontory is 541 m.
